ngiemboon: Á laa na lyɛ̌ʼ tʉ̂a na saŋ lekùɔ á na ngùʼ mbɔ́ɔntè móm tá páʼ mé la zyé wɔ́ɔn, n gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Kebaa, á nùɔ petsɔ́ pa Ésàlayɛ pie mé la lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo megàŋatsaŋá ncù. N gyá ncwò tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ́ʼɔ, e Ssé nyɛ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn, ńgyá tsɔ́ shúm.
en: In the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, while I was among the exiles by the Chebar Canal,   the heavens were opened  # 1:1 Mt 3:16; Mk 1:10; Lk 3:21; Jn 1:51; Ac 7:56; 10:11; Rv 4:1; 19:11 and I saw visions of God.  # 1:1 Ex 24:10; Nm 12:6; Ezk 8:3; 11:24; 40:2

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ tʉ̂a laa púʼu, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngùʼ tʉ̂a páʼ mé la gwoon Joyakiŋ gẅie à laa fùɔ pà Yúndà ńdɔg ńgʉa, á cʉ́ʼʉ ngàŋatsaŋá ncù.
en: On the fifth day of the month #— #it was the fifth year of King Jehoiachin’s exile    #— #

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu peg gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Mbambilonia, á ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Kebaa, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn nò mbwó mèŋ, á mèŋ Ezekîɛ míŋ nùŋepwɔʼ gẅie lezíŋ sé laa lê Mbuzi. Áa jʉʼ gie metʉ̀ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kúu na mèŋ wó.
en: the word of the Lord came   directly to the priest Ezekiel  # 1:3 Ezk 24:24 son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans  # 1:3 Gn 11:28 by the Chebar Canal. The Lord’s hand was on him there.  # 1:3 1Kg 18:46; 2Kg 3:15; 1Ch 28:19; Ezk 3:14–22; 37:1; 40:1; Ezr 7:6,28

ngiemboon: N da ne ńdíe, ńgyá tsɔ́ ntʉ̀ fóm fó kwóŋ ngwòŋ ńtó, lé kɔ̌ɔn melɔ́ɔn gie á gẅiin melʉ́me mmɔ̌g. Akyɛ̀ʼ la pú ńkéle melɔ́ɔn. Esoŋ wɛ̌ pú ne ńŋwáŋte páʼ tsɔ̌ ntí tʉ̌ gie mé tǔɔ mmɔ̌g.
en: I looked, and there was a whirlwind   coming from the north, a huge cloud with fire flashing back and forth and brilliant light all around it. In the center of the fire, there was a gleam like amber.  # 1:4 Ezk 1:27; 8:2

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsoló, mé ne ńgyá mentí pʉ̀a lekùɔ pie ée ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, ńgẅiin liŋé pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: The likeness of four living creatures came from it,   and this was their appearance: They looked something like a human,

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ na pɔ́b la gẅiin meshÿó lekùɔ, ńgẅiin mbabá lekùɔ.
en: but each of them had four faces and four wings.

ngiemboon: Mentɔ́ɔn mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ, melɔ̌ɔn mekwò mɔ́b gwɔ́ páʼ menkǐb mekwò fòŋ, ḿbiŋ ne ńŋwʉŋe páʼ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ gie mé tsegé.
en: Their legs were straight, and the soles of their feet were like the hooves of a calf, sparkling like the gleam of polished bronze.

ngiemboon: Mbabá lekùɔ ntsèm mie pɔ́ la gẅiin, apwó nyìŋ mesoŋ laa tsìŋe wó. Mbwó mɔ́b ŋwɛ́ la sele ńdíe meshÿó mengwòŋ lekùɔ, páʼ meshÿó mɔ́b lekùɔ lâ mbabá mɔ́b.
en: They had human hands under their wings on their four sides.   All four of them had faces and wings.  # 1:8 Ezk 10:8,21

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ na pɔ́b la lɔg metwó mbabá mé, ńkíbe metwó me wetsɔ̌. Pɔ́ giŋe pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ ńne ńdíe mvfò té sele nnɛ́.
en: Their wings were touching. The creatures did not turn as they moved; each one went straight ahead.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ la gẅiin meshÿó lekùɔ, eshÿó we nyìŋ mesoŋ líe mvfò, eshÿó we púʼntʉ̀ gwɔ́ na pwó tʉ̀, eshÿó we ndúm fòŋ gwɔ́ na pwó kyɛ̀bɛ, eshÿó we gúmndóŋ líe nzèm.
en: Their faces looked something like the face of a human,   and each of the four had the face of a lion on the right, the face of an ox on the left, and the face of an eagle.  # 1:10 Ezk 10:14–21

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa na mbabá mɔ́b, ḿbʉʼʉ me mémbʉ́a, ńnáa tÿǒ, é gʉa ńtswéʼe na mbabá me wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ, metsɔ́ mémbʉ́a kábte mbùm yɔb.
en: That is what their faces were like. Their wings were spread upward; each had two wings touching that of another and two wings covering its body.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgiŋe pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ líe pɔ́ mvfò yé. Pɔ́ gʉa né jʉʼ gie zẅìge tsoté wɔ́b légʉa né wó. Te tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́b sele nnɛ́.
en: Each creature went straight ahead.   Wherever the Spirit  # 1:12 Or spirit, also in v. 20 wanted to go, they went without turning as they moved.  # 1:12 Ezk 1:20

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ mmó laa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɛ̌ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ megɔ̀ʼ mmɔ̌g mie é ne ńkÿó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mmó lɔg ńkyɛʼ jʉʼ gie á ne ńŋele la. Mmɔ̌g ne ńŋwʉŋe, menně mbʉ̀ŋ ne ńŋwaŋte.
en: The likeness of the living creatures was like the appearance of blazing coals of fire or like torches.   Fire was moving back and forth between the living creatures; it was bright, with lightning coming out of it.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ apɛ̌ lɔ́ɔn ńgee, ḿbiŋe ńgíŋe ḿbiŋe nzèm pɔ́ páʼ mé gɔɔn lɔɔn; páʼ nně mbʉ̀ŋ gie e gÿo lê ŋwaŋ la.
en: The creatures were darting back and forth   like flashes of lightning.  # 1:14 Mt 24:27; Lk 17:24

ngiemboon: N da ne ńdíe wɔ́b, ńgyá atsɔ́ mmó nuŋe ssé ńgwɔ́ páʼ kwò kélêg la, ńnuŋe ńkéle wɛ̌ wɛ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́ɔ, á na meshÿó lekùɔ.
en: When I looked at the living creatures, there was one wheel on the ground beside each of the four-faced creatures.

ngiemboon: Mekwò ŋwɛ́ la ne ńŋwʉŋe páʼ tsɔ́ ntí tʉ̀nzẅìŋ tóon. Pɔ́ la pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tàʼa mmó, mbà mé la táŋte na ntí gie yetsɔ́ ge kúu tsɛ̀ɛ yetsɔ́.
en: The appearance of the wheels   and their craftsmanship was like the gleam of beryl,  # 1:16 Dn 10:6 and all four had the same likeness. Their appearance and craftsmanship was like a wheel within a wheel.

ngiemboon: Mekwò mɛ̌ lekùɔ la kuʼu légʉa na meshÿó lekùɔ té tsɔ́ na mekwò sele nnɛ́ ye.
en: When they moved, they went in any of the four directions, without turning as they moved.

ngiemboon: Ntyě mekwò ŋwɛ́ la pú ńgáʼ ńgʉa tÿǒ, tà ḿvege nyìŋ, ńgẅiin mepǎb jʉʼ ntsèm páʼ menÿɔ́g mie é ne ńŋwʉŋe.
en: Their four rims were tall and awe-inspiring, completely covered with eyes.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a apɛ̌ la ne ńgiŋe fʉ̀ʼʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, mekwò ŋwɛ́ giŋe yɔ́b lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ lu ssé na tsetsáʼ, lézie né tÿǒ, mekwò mɛ̌ zie yɔ́b né tÿǒ.
en: When the living creatures moved,   the wheels moved beside them, and when the creatures rose from the earth, the wheels also rose.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgee jʉʼ gie zẅìge la ne ńtsóte wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa wó, pâ mekwò mɛ̌ lekùɔ zɔ púu ńgee, á nue mekwò mɔɔn lekùɔ lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie pɛ̌ pʉ̀a lekùɔ ne ńkwoŋo.
en: Wherever the Spirit wanted to go, the creatures went in the direction the Spirit was moving. The wheels rose alongside them, for the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgee fʉ̀ʼʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ gie pʉ̀a apɛ̌ ne ńgiŋe, kà ńtyé tyé wɔ́ɔ, kà ńdu pɔ́ ssé lézie ńkwɔ́ʼ né tÿǒ wɔ́ɔ, mekwò ŋwɛ́ ké ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ púʼu, á nue azẅìge gie á laa na pʉ̀a apɛ̌, yɛ̌ zɔ̌ la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ na mekwò.
en: When the creatures moved, the wheels moved; when the creatures stopped, the wheels stopped; and when the creatures rose from the earth, the wheels rose alongside them, for the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a apɛ̌ la gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó ndù pɔ́b, á gwɔ́ páʼ ntsɔ̀ʼ tépàa gie é lɔ̌ɔn ńkábte wɔ́b, ḿbú ńŋwʉŋe páʼ tsɔ̌ ntí meŋwʉ́ŋe.
en: Over the heads of the living creatures   the likeness of an expanse  # 1:22 Gn 1:6–8 was spread out. It gleamed like awe-inspiring crystal,  # 1:22 Rv 4:6

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsìŋe ssé na yɛ̌ ntsɔ̀ʼ ŋwɛ́, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ na pɔ́b gẅiin mbabá mémbʉ́a mie é tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ, ńtswéʼe na me petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. Ńgíŋ ńgẅiin metsɔ́ mbabá mémbʉ́a mie wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ lɔg ńkábte ye mbùm.
en: and under the expanse their wings extended one toward another. They each also had two wings covering their bodies.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńgiŋe, n júʼ ntí gie mbabá mɔ́b lɔgɔ ńzẅɛɛ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ ngyè memǎa mentse, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ lefaŋ sie é vɛ́te, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ ngyè Ngàŋa Tʉ̀ Ntsèm, kà pɔ́ páʼ ngyè máa nùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù wɔ́ɔ. Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńgiŋe tà ńtyé fʉ̀ʼʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, ésẅíʼi mbabá mɔ́b.
en: When they moved, I heard the sound of their wings like the roar of a huge torrent,   like the voice of the Almighty,  # 1:24 Ezk 10:5 and a sound of tumult like the noise of an army.  # 1:24 Dn 10:6 When they stopped, they lowered their wings.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔ́ɔn ńjúʼu, etsɔ̌ ngyè fóo ndùm ntsɔ̀ʼ gie é kábte twó sɔ́b, á gwɔ́ na fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ gǐŋ tà ńtyé, ésẅíʼi mbabá mɔ́b.
en: A voice came from above the expanse over their heads; when they stopped, they lowered their wings.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ ndùm ntsɔ̀ʼ gie e kábte twó sɔ́b, etsɔ̌ ntí tóon gie mé tóŋ lê Safii gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ páʼ tsɔ́ lʉŋe lefùɔ la. Á gwɔ́ jʉʼʉ yɛ̌ lʉŋe lefùɔ né kúkwóŋ, atsɔ́ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ we nyìŋ mesoŋ la.
en: Something like a throne with the appearance of lapis lazuli was above the expanse over their heads.   On the throne, high above, was someone who looked like a human.  # 1:26 Is 6:1; Ezk 24:10

ngiemboon: N gyá wɛ̌ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ ŋwáŋte páʼ tsɔ̌ ntí tʉ̌ gie á ŋwʉŋe ŋwʉŋe, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie mmɔ̌g kéle ńnéŋe soŋ la. Á gwɔ́ jʉʼ gie áa kúkwóŋ na zẅɛ̌ʼ yé, pɔ́ jʉʼ gie áa ntsintsíŋ na zẅɛ̌ʼ yé, n gyá tsɔ́ mmó páʼ mmɔ̌g gẅie é kyɛʼɛ yé meshÿó ntsèm.
en: From what seemed to be his waist up, I saw a gleam like amber, with what looked like fire enclosing it all around.   From what seemed to be his waist down, I also saw what looked like fire. There was a brilliant light all around him.

ngiemboon: Akyɛ̀ʼ gie á pú ńkéle yé, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ kyɛ̀ʼ gie á kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ lekwoŋ nnúngém sie é kyɛʼɛ jʉʼ fʉ̀ʼʉ zsǒ á tsɛ̀ɛ nèm mbʉ̀ŋ. À lɔgɔ púʼu, ńgwɔ́ liŋé legúʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gie á kẅɛ̌ɛ, n gyá púʼu ńkẅíʼte ssé, ésɔb shÿó wɔ́ɔn ssé, n deen ńké júʼ nyìŋ gɔɔn nò né mèŋ.
en: The appearance of the brilliant light all around was like that of a rainbow in a cloud on a rainy day.   This was the appearance of the likeness of the Lord’s glory.  # 1:28 Ex 24:16; Ezk 8:4; 11:22–23; 43:4–5 When I saw it, I fell facedown and heard a voice speaking.  # 1:28 Gn 17:3; Ezk 3:23; Dn 8:17; Rv 1:17
